results.definition: cause to be thrilled by some perceptual input
examples: The men were thrilled by a loud whistle blow

results.definition: feel sudden intense sensation or emotion
examples: he was thrilled by the speed and the roar of the engine

results.definition: tremble convulsively, as from fear or excitement

examples: The children were thrilled at the prospect of going to the movies
He was inebriated by his phenomenal success

results.definition: causing a surge of emotion or excitement
causing quivering or shivering as by cold or fear or electric shock
examples: a thrilling wind blew off the frozen lake
